extractions.description: This study introduces ICE-SEARCH, a methodology that combines language models (LMs) with evolutionary algorithms for feature selection in Medical Predictive Analytics (MPA). ICE-SEARCH employs LMs for crossover and mutation within an evolutionary framework, enhancing FS by utilizing the modelâ€™s comprehensive world knowledge.

title.value: ICE-SEARCH: A Language Model-Driven Feature Selection Approach
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper.
title.quote: ICE-SEARCH: A L ANGUAGE M ODEL -D RIVEN F EATURE S ELECTION A PPROACH

type.justification: The paper details experimental evaluations using ICE-SEARCH on datasets related to stroke, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes, demonstrating its effectiveness empirically.
type.quote: Our evaluation of this methodology spans three crucial MPA tasks: stroke, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes

research_field.justification: The study focuses on leveraging deep learning methodologies, particularly language models, within feature selection tasks.
research_field.quote: The proposed In-Context Evolutionary Search (ICE-SEARCH) method is the first work that melds language models (LMs) with evolutionary algorithms for feature selection (FS) tasks

sub_research_field.justification: The core contribution of the paper is in the domain of feature selection, using innovative techniques that combine language models with evolutionary algorithms.
sub_research_field.quote: In this context, the process of feature selection (FS) becomes critically important. By identifying the most pertinent subset of features within vast datasets, FS facilitates a more efficient analysis.

name.justification: ICE-SEARCH is the primary model introduced in this paper for feature selection.
name.quote: ICE-SEARCH is the first work to apply an LM to dynamically search for valuable feature sets through role-playing and improve its in-context prompting examples without any fine-tuning.

type.justification: ICE-SEARCH is specifically designed to perform feature selection tasks within an evolutionary framework.
type.quote: IC E-S EARCH : Fe ature Selection with Language Model

name.justification: The paper uses this dataset to validate the effectiveness of ICE-SEARCH in predicting stroke.
name.quote: The stroke prediction dataset from Kaggle ( Fedesoriano [2021]) comprises 10 parameters including patient age, gender, medical history.

name.justification: The paper uses this dataset to validate the effectiveness of ICE-SEARCH in predicting cardiovascular diseases.
name.quote: The cardiovascular health dataset ( Ulianova [2019]) has a near-equal distribution of both outcomes.

name.justification: The paper uses this dataset to validate the effectiveness of ICE-SEARCH in predicting diabetes.
name.quote: The diabetes dataset ( Teboul [2021]) features 218K negative samples, 35K positive samples, and no missing entries.

name.justification: The paper utilizes the Phi-2 model as the backbone language model for ICE-SEARCH.
name.quote: In the experiment, we use Phi2 ( Javaheripi and Bubeck [2023]) and 4-bit quantized version of LLaMA2 7B( Touvron et al. [2023]) models respectively as the backbone LM

name.justification: The paper uses the 4-bit quantized version of LLaMA2 7B model as a backbone for evaluating ICE-SEARCH.
